tit.cmt: (Sanuki of Nijoin) 次のセルにあるので、削除しました。

sen.j: 二条院讃岐（にじょういん の さぬき、永治元年（1141年）頃? - 建保5年（1217年）頃?）は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代前期にかけての女流歌人。
sen.e: Nijoin no Sanuki (Sanuki of Nijoin, around 1141?-around 1217?) was a Japanese poetess of the late Heian and the early Kamakura period.
Nijoin no Sanuki (Sanuki of Nijoin, ca. 1141? - ca. 1217?) was a Japanese poetess of the late Heian and the early Kamakura period.
Nijoin no Sanuki (Sanuki of Nijoin, ca. 1141 - ca. 1217) was a poetess of the late Heian and the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 内讃岐、中宮讃岐とも称される。
sen.e: She is also called Uchi-Sanuki or Chugu Sanuki.
She is also called Uchi-Sanuki or Chugu Sanuki.
She is also called Uchi-Sanuki or Chugu Sanuki.

sen.j: 父は源頼政、母は源斉頼の娘。
sen.e: Her father was MINAMOTO no Yorimasa and her mother was the daughter of MINAMOTO no Masayori.
Her father was MINAMOTO no Yorimasa and her mother was the daughter of MINAMOTO no Masayori.
Her father was MINAMOTO no Yorimasa and her mother was the daughter of MINAMOTO no Masayori.

sen.j: 二条天皇（二条院）に仕え、天皇が崩御した後、藤原重頼と結婚している。
sen.e: She served the Emperor Nijo (Nijoin), and after his death she married FUJIWARA no Shigeyori.
She served the Emperor Nijo (Nijoin), and after his death she married FUJIWARA no Shigeyori.
She served the Emperor Nijo (Nijoin), and after his death she married FUJIWARA no Shigeyori.

sen.j: その頃には歌人として評判を得ており「歌仙落書」に入っている。
sen.e: By then she already had a good reputation as a poetess, and she was selected for 'kasen rakugaki'.
By then she already had a good reputation as a poetess, and she was selected for 'kasen rakugaki.'
By then she already had a good reputation as a poetess, and she was selected for 'kasen rakugaki.'

sen.j: 建久元年（1190年）頃、後鳥羽天皇の中宮九条任子（宜秋門院）に再出仕したが、後に出家。
sen.e: In around 1190, she returned to court to attend the Emperor Gotoba's empress, Ninshi KUJO (Gishumonin), but later she became a Buddhist nun.
In around 1190, she returned to court to attend the Emperor Gotoba's empress, Ninshi KUJO (Gishumonin), but later she became a Buddhist nun.
In around 1190, she returned to court to attend the Emperor Gotoba's empress, Ninshi KUJO (Gishumonin), but later she became a Buddhist nun.

sen.j: 隠棲後も後鳥羽上皇、順徳天皇の歌壇に迎えられている。
sen.e: Even after she retired from the world, she was welcomed by the waka circles of the Retired Emperor Gotoba and of the Emperor Juntoku,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even after she became a nun, she was welcomed by the waka circles of the Retired Emperor Gotoba and of the Emperor Juntoku.
Even after she became a nun, she was welcomed by the waka circles of the Retired Emperor Gotoba and of the Emperor Juntoku.

sen.j: 「正治二年初度百首」「千五百番歌合」に歌が乗せられている。
sen.e: Some of her poems were selected for the 'Shoji ninen shodo hyakushu' (Hundred-Poem Sequence of the Shoji Era) and the 'Sengohyaku ban Uta-awase' (One thousand and five hundreds Set of Poetry Match).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some of her poems were selected for the 'Shoji ninen shodo hyakushu' (Hundred-Poem Sequence of the Shoji Era) and the 'Sengohyaku ban Uta-awase' (One thousand and five hundreds Set of Poetry Match).
Some of her poems were selected for the 'Shoji ninen shodo hyakushu' (Hundred-Poem Sequence of the Shoji Era) and the 'Sengohyaku ban Uta-awase' (One thousand and five hundreds Set of Poetry Match).

sen.j: 家集に『二条院讃岐集』がある。
sen.e: She has a personal collection "Nijoin no Sanuki Shu".
She has a personal collection "Nijoin no Sanuki Shu."
She has a personal collection "Nijoin no Sanuki Shu."

sen.j: 『小倉百人一首』から
sen.e: From "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets")
From "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets")
From "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" (The Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)

sen.j: わが袖は 潮干（しおひ）に見えぬ 沖の石の 人こそ知らぬ 乾く間もなし
sen.e: My sleeves have not a moment to dry, just like the reefs lying offshore that cannot be seen even at low tide, although no one knows about it.
sen.cmt: 原文Webページを確認したところ、この歌の部分が抜けていたため追加しました。
sen.e: My sleeves have not a moment to dry, just like the reefs lying offshore that cannot be seen even at low tide, although no one knows about it.
My sleeves have not a moment to dry, just like the reefs lying offshore that cannot be seen even at low tide, although no one knows about it.

sen.j: 「沖の石の讃岐」はこの歌によりつけられた異名である。
sen.e: Her nickname 'Oki no ishi no Sanuki' (literally, "Sanuki of the offshore reefs) came from this poem.
Her nickname 'Oki no ishi no Sanuki' (literally, "Sanuki of the offshore reefs) came from this poem.
Her nickname 'Oki no ishi no Sanuki' (literally, "Sanuki of the offshore reefs") came from this poem.

sen.j: 二条院讃岐の下記の歌は延々と続く本歌取りのもととなった。
sen.e: The following poem by Nijoin no Sanuki became the source of one after another poetic allusion:
sen.cmt: 原文「二条院讃岐の」「世にふるは苦しきものを槙の屋にやすくも過ぐる初時雨かな」「は延々と続く本歌取りのもととなった。」と三行に分かれておりましたので、一行目と三行目をまとめ、「下記の歌」と付け加えました。
sen.e: The following poem by Nijoin no Sanuki became the source of one after another poetic allusion:
The following poem by Nijoin no Sanuki became the source of one after another poetic allusion:

sen.j: 世にふるは苦しきものを槙の屋にやすくも過ぐる初時雨かな
sen.e: Yo ni furu ha Kurushiki mono wo Maki no ya ni Yasukumo suguru Hatsu shugure kana
Yo ni furu ha Kurushiki mono wo Maki no ya ni Yasukumo suguru Hatsu shugure kana
Yo ni furu ha Kurushiki mono wo Maki no ya ni Yasukumo suguru Hatsu shigure kana

sen.j: これは「世の中を、人と関わり合いながら生きてゆくのは、苦しいものだわ。
sen.e: It means, 'it is hard to live a life connected with others.
It means, 'It is hard to live a life connected with others.
It means, 'It is hard to live a life connected with others.

sen.j: そんな思いで冬の夜を過ごしていたら、槙で葺いた屋根を叩いて初時雨が通り過ぎていった。
sen.e: When I was thinking about such thing on a winter night, the first early winter shower passed by, falling on the yew-thatched roof.
When I was thinking about such things on a winter night, the first early winter shower passed by, falling on the yew-thatched roof.
When I was thinking about such things on a winter night, the first early winter shower passed by, falling on the yew-thatched roof.

sen.j: 辛い思いをしている人の家の上を、なんとまあやすやすと過ぎてゆく雨だこと。」という意味である。
sen.e: How easily the rain passes over the house of those having a difficult time'.
How easily the rain passes over the house of those having a difficult time.'
How easily the rain passes over the house of those having a difficult time.'

sen.j: 「恋愛に鬱屈しているところへ、恋人は訪れず代りにしぐれの雨が過ぎていった。
sen.e: When the woman was feeling depressed over her love life, an early winter shower passed her by instead of her lover.
When the woman was feeling depressed over her love life, an early winter shower passed her by instead of her lover.
When the woman was feeling depressed over her love life, an early winter shower passed her by instead of her lover.

sen.j: という恋歌の風情を纏綿させている、『ふる』の使いわけに、歌の中心がある」
sen.e: The core of this poem is the use of "furu" that entangles the poem with the atmosphere of a love song.'
The core of this poem is the use of "furu" that entangles the poem with the atmosphere of a love song.'
The core of this poem is the use of "furu" that entangles the poem with the atmosphere of a love song.'

sen.j: というのは、浅い読みで、人事と自然の対比にこそ「歌の中心」があると言うべき。という。
sen.e: Some say that the above interpretation is shallow, and that 'the heart of the poem' is actually in the comparison between human affairs and nature.
Some say that the above interpretation is shallow, and that 'the heart of the poem' is actually in the comparison between human affairs and nature.
Some say that the above interpretation is shallow, and that 'the heart of the poem' is actually in the comparison between human affairs and nature.

sen.j: 後続の歌
sen.e: Poems afterwards
Poems afterwards
Poems afterwards

sen.j: まぱらなる槙の板屋に音はして漏らぬ時雨や木の葉なるらん
sen.e: The sounds on the sparse yew-thatched roof shingles might be because of the leaves or an early winter shower that does not leak in.
The sounds on the sparse yew-thatched roof shingles might be because of the leaves or an early winter shower that does not leak in.
The sounds on the sparse yew-thatched roof shingles might be because of the leaves or an early winter shower that does not leak in.

sen.j: - 藤原俊成『千載集』
sen.e: Composed by FUJIWARA no Toshinari, "Senzai shu" (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)
Composed by FUJIWARA no Toshinari, "Senzai shu" (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)
Composed by FUJIWARA no Toshinari, "Senzai shu" (Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)

sen.j: さゆる夜の槙の板屋のひとり寝に心くだけと霰ふるなり
sen.e: When I sleep alone on a cold night, small hail falls on the yew-thatched roof shingles as if it were breaking my heart into pieces.
When I sleep alone on a cold night, small hail falls on the yew-thatched roof shingles as if it were breaking my heart into pieces.
When I sleep alone on a cold night, small hail falls on the yew-thatched roof shingles as if it were breaking my heart into pieces.

sen.j: - 九条良経『千載集』
sen.e: Composed by Yoshitsune KUJO, "Senzaishu"
Composed by Yoshitsune KUJO, "Senzaishu"
Composed by Yoshitsune KUJO, "Senzaishu"

sen.j: この二条院讃岐の歌は、さまざまな連歌・俳諧に取り入れられていった。
sen.e: Various renga (linked-verse) and haikai poems used this poem by Nijoin no Sanuki.
Various renga (linked-verse) and haikai poems used this poem by Nijoin no Sanuki.
Various renga (linked-verse) and haikai poems used this poem by Nijoin no Sanuki.

sen.j: 世々ふるもさらに時雨のやどり哉
sen.e: Time has passed, and again there is an early winter shower staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is an early winter shower staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is an early winter shower staying for a while.

sen.j: - 後村上天皇
sen.e: Composed by the Emperor Gomurakami
Composed by the Emperor Gomurakami
Composed by the Emperor Gomurakami

sen.j: 雲はなほ定めある世のしぐれかな
sen.e: The clouds are still an early winter shower in this bound world.
The clouds are still an early winter shower in this bound world.
The clouds are still an early winter shower in this bound world.

sen.j: - 心敬
sen.e: Composed by Shinkei
Composed by Shinkei
Composed by Shinkei

sen.j: 世にふるもさらに時雨のやどりかな
sen.e: Time has passed, and again there is a further early winter shower staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is more early winter shower staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is more early winter shower staying for a while.

sen.j: - 宗祇
sen.e: Composed by Sogi
Composed by Sogi
Composed by Sogi

sen.j: 時雨の身いはゞ髭ある宗祇かな
sen.e: Staying in an early winter shower--it is as if I were Sogi with a beard.
Staying in an early winter shower--it is as if I were Sogi with a beard.
Staying in an early winter shower--it is as if I were Sogi with a beard.

sen.j: - 素堂
sen.e: Composed by Sodo
Composed by Sodo
Composed by Sodo

sen.j: 世にふるも更に宗祇のやどり哉
sen.e: Time has passed, and again there is Sogi staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is Sogi staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is Sogi staying for a while.

sen.j: - 芭蕉
sen.e: Composed by Basho
Composed by Basho
Composed by Basho

sen.j: 世にふるもさらに祇空のやどりかな
sen.e: Time has passed, and again there is Giku staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is Giku staying for a while.
Time has passed, and again there is Giku staying for a while.

sen.j: - 淡々
sen.e: Composed by Tantan
Composed by Tantan
Composed by Tantan

sen.j: 世にふるはさらにはせをの時雨哉
sen.e: Time has passed, and again there is Basho's early winter shower.
Time has passed, and again there is Basho's early winter shower.
Time has passed, and again there is Basho's early winter shower.

sen.j: - 井上士朗
sen.e: Composed by Shiro INOUE
Composed by Shiro INOUE
Composed by Shiro INOUE

sen.j: 時雨るゝや吾も古人の夜に似たる
sen.e: Oh, an early winter shower--just like my nights and those of the ancients.
Oh, an early winter shower--just like my nights and those of the ancients.
Oh, an early winter shower--just like my nights and those of the ancients.

sen.j: - 蕪村
sen.e: Composed by Buson
Composed by Buson
Composed by Buson
